s.text: What we weren't told, though, was whether the "average" here was the mean or the median.

Day traders and technical-trading firms now account for a significant percentage of each day's volume on both the Nasdaq and the NYSE, and by essentially trading stocks among themselves--and serving as buyers and sellers for the rest of us--they have contributed massively to share turnover.

And as it's become clearer and clearer that mutual-fund managers and stockbrokers are no more likely to have market-beating knowledge than the average investor is, it's also become harder to justify giving your money to either, especially with the fees they charge.
